name: editor-for-svelte
description: Create a simple, customizable code editor for Svelte.
readme:
# SvelteEditor A simple but customizable code editor made with Svelte and tailwindcss. (Inspired from [React Simple Code Editor](https://github.com/react-simple-code-editor/react-simple-code-editor/)) ## Features - Syntax highlighting for various languages using highlight.js - Line numbers - Customizable styles ## Installation ```bash npm install -D editor-for-svelte ``` ### Make sure you have highlight.js installed for theming ```bash npm install -D highlight.js ``` ## Usage ### Edit your tailwind.config.js file to add support for the editor ```javascript /** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */ export default { content: ["./node_modules/editor-for-svelte/src/**/*.svelte"], theme: { extend: {}, }, plugins: [], } ``` ```svelte ``` See [examples](#examples) for more ## Props | Prop | Type | Default | Description | Usage | |-------------------|---------|---------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------| | value | string | " " | The code in the editor | `` | | language | string | "javascript" | The language of the code (view highlight.js docs for all languages supported) | `` | | lines | boolean | false | Show line numbers | `` | | caretColor | string | "black" | The color of the caret (must be color not class) | `` | | dots | boolean | false | Show macOS dots to make it look like a terminal | `` | | maxHeight | string | "100vh" | The maximum height of the editor including external padding (recommended to be at least 150px) | `` | | class | string | " " | Additional classes to be added to the editor | `` | | lineNumberClass | string | " " | Additional classes to be added to the line number container | `` | | defaultText | string | "Start typing or paste some code to see syntax highlighting!" | The default text to be shown when the editor is empty | `` | | lineSelector | boolean | false | Show toggle for line numbers | `` | | langSelector | boolean | false | Show toggle for language | `` | | minHeight | string | "80px" | The minimum height of the editor (including external padding) | `` | | langSelectorClass | string | " " | Additional classes to be added to the language selector container | `` | | lineSelectorClass | string | " " | Additional classes to be added to the line selector container | `` | | id | string | " " | The id of the editor | `` | | hljs | object | Default hljs object from highlight.js | Custom highlight.js object for more customization | `` | ## Tips - To change the theme, import the css file from highlight.js and change the theme in the import statement in the script tag - If a class doesn't apply when adding it as a prop, try placing a `!` before the class to make it important (eg. `!text-red-500`) - Dont set the height in the class prop, instead use the minHeight and maxHeight props for best results - If you want multiple editors with different themes, place them in seperate components so that you can import different themes for each editor. - If you want to use a language that is not included in the default highlight.js package, you can create a custom highlight.js object and pass it as a prop to the editor. ##
